Pre-Game Insights: Reliever Ryan Burr will throw Toronto's first pitch in the game, which resumes in the top of the second inning after rain washed out the majority of the contest on June 26 at Fenway Park.
The Blue Jays employ a similar formula in Boston with Burr opening the game and being replaced by bulk pitcher Ryan Yarbrough.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blue Jays acquired Ryan Burr at the end of May from the Philadelphia Phillies' triple-A affiliate.
Burr is 0-1 with a 5.12 ERA in 19.1 innings for the Blue Jays this season.
Catch the Blue Jays-Red Sox opener at 2 p.m. ET / 11 a.m. PT on Sportsnet or Sportsnet+.
Others: José Berríos now will start Monday's second game against Boston.
Yariel Rodriguez, who is slated to start Tuesday, was the original starter for the Blue Jays on June 26.
